author: IGN
description: Enjoy student life, get a part-time job, hang with friends, and more. Check out the latest Persona 5: The Phantom X trailer for this upcoming RPG to learn about the life you can lead as a student at Kokatsu Academy. Persona 5: The Phantom X will be available on PC and mobile on June 26, 2025.
title: Persona 5: The Phantom X - Official 'Student Life' Trailer

author: IGN
description:
The June 21, 2025 patch brings sunshine, fresh crops, wild mutations, adorable new pets, and so much more! In this video, we break down everything you need to know about the latest Grow a Garden update — from new summer-themed cosmetics to powerful mutation weather events like Tornadoes and Heat Waves.

00:00 - Intro
00:17 - New Crops
00:50 - Summer Harvest Event
01:05 - New Crop Mutations
01:35 - New Items
01:52 - New Pets and Pet Eggs
02:31 - Various Fixes
title: Grow a Garden: Summer Update Breakdown! (New Crops, Pets, Events)

author: IGN
description: Check out the Announcement Trailer for Sobakistan: The Land of Dogs, a satirical narrative adventure game developed by Terletski Games. Players will find themselves in a totalitarian country inhabited entirely by anthropomorphic dogs. Uncover the secrets of Sobakistan with six playable characters across 13 chapters. Sobakistan: The Land of Dogs is coming in 2026 to PC (Steam).
title: Sobakistan: The Land of Dogs - Official Announcement Trailer

author: IGN
description: You are justice. The Arbites class has arrived. Check out the latest Warhammer 40,000: Darktide trailer for the action game to see the Arbites class in action. The Arbites class DLC for Warhammer 40,000: Darktide is available now on PC, PlayStation 5 (PS5), and Xbox Series X|S. Additionally, a free update, Battle for Tertium, is also available. A reworked narrative experience and mission board are available, as well as a new difficulty for the Mortis Trials activity, the Inferno live event, a new Havoc campaign, Quality of Life changes, and some weapon balancing.
title: Warhammer 40,000: Darktide - Official Arbites Class Launch Trailer

author: IGN
description: Join game director Jacek Zięba and lead combat designer Shamil Yanbukhtin from developer Bloober Team for a deep dive into the combat system of Cronos: The New Dawn in this new video for the upcoming horror survival game. Learn how enemies (called Orphans) merge with corpses to evolve for harder fights, various strategies for taking on foes, resource management, different enemy types, traveler missions, the weapon-mounted scanner, and more. Cronos: The New Dawn will be available on PC, PlayStation 5 (PS5), and Xbox Series X/S in fall 2025.
title: Cronos: The New Dawn - Official Combat Overview Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Full spoilers follow!
Since the 28 Years Later franchise seems to be sticking around, let’s take a look at how the new film sets the stage for future sequels. Specifically, we want to look at 28 Years’ ending, which has left many early viewers flabbergasted. Join us as we dive into all the spoilery details of 28 Years Later.
After Spike (Alfie Williams) has to say goodbye to his mother, who doctor Ian Kelson (Ralph Fiennes) consensually euthanizes after diagnosing her with cancer, he returns a newborn baby recovered from an infected mother (the baby is uninfected because of the way the placenta works) to his island village. He also leaves a note for his father Jamie (Aaron Taylor-Johnson), where he explains that he’s going to keep exploring the mainland and may return home someday.
But when he’s pursued by a larger group, Spike is saved by a group led by a man named Jimmy (Sinners’ Jack O’Connell), an older version of the only child to survive the film’s grisly prologue. Boyle told IG
title: 28 Years Later: What That Bizarre Ending Means for the Franchise

author: IGN
description: When all but one child from the same class mysteriously vanish on the same night at exactly the same time, a community is left questioning who or what is behind their disappearance. The film stars Josh Brolin, Julia Garner, Alden Ehrenreich, Austin Abrams, Cary Christopher, with Benedict Wong, and Amy Madigan.
title: Weapons - Official Trailer #2 (2025) Josh Brolin, Julia Garner, Alden Ehrenreich

author: IGN
description:
Play as a chaotic-neutral barbarian with a GED who's forced to slog (and slash) through the corporate world in Cybrlich and the Death Cult of Labor, the upcoming super-stylized first-person boomer shooter. Wishlist it on Steam if you're interested: https://store.steampowered.com/app/3336070/CYBRLICH_and_the_Death_Cult_of_Labor/

#IGN  #Gaming
title: Cybrlich: Official Uncensored Gameplay Trailer

author: IGN
description:
When an officer with the Department of Homeland Security is murdered in broad daylight, LAPD detective Mark Meachum is recruited to a secret task force, alongside undercover agents from all branches of law enforcement, to investigate. But the hunt for the killer soon uncovers a plot far more sinister than anyone could have imagined, kicking off a race against time to save a city of millions. 

The cast is led by Jensen Ackles (The Boys, Supernatural), Eric Dane (Grey’s Anatomy, Euphoria), and Jessica Camacho (The Flash, Watchmen). The series also stars Violett Beane (Death and Other Details), Elliot Knight (The Boys), and Uli Latukefu (Young Rock).

Created by One Chicago and FBI Executive Producer Derek Haas, Countdown launches June 25 with a three-episode debut on Prime Video.

#IGN  #Movies
title: Countdown - Exclusive Clip (2025) Jensen Ackles, Eric Dane, Jessica Camacho

author: IGN
description:
With the release of Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, director Hideo Kojima enters his fourth decade in game development as a director. While the celebrated “auteur” has spent the majority of his career so far working on the Metal Gear Solid series, Death Stranding 2 sees him expanding upon his newest universe, where he both introduces new concepts and revisits some of his most enduring ideas.

With a truly staggering list of credits in his impressive resume, there’s no better time to revisit every genre-defying adventure Kojima has taken us on. Here is every Kojima game that he directed or designed, ranked from worst to best by IGN’s staff.

#ign #deathstranding #kojima
title: Every Hideo Kojima Game, Ranked

author: IGN
description:
Watch the latest Fortnite x Squid Game collaboration short trailer. Get ready to rift into Reload - Squid Grounds, featuring a map designed and inspired by Netflix's Squid Game. The Fortnite Shop will also feature Squid Game-inspired cosmetics. Fortnite x Squid Game Reload - Squid Grounds will be available June 27, 2025

#IGN #Fortnite #SquidGame
title: Fortnite x Squid Game - Official 'Pink Guard Gets the W' Short Trailer

author: IGN
description:
The long-awaited sequel to Kojima Productions’ Death Stranding has finally arrived! In this video, we dive into the opening moments of Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, featuring a mix of cinematic cutscenes and the first delivery mission.
Captured in stunning 4K 60FPS on the PlayStation 5 Pro, this DS2 gameplay showcase gives you a first look at the visual upgrades, immersive world-building, and mysterious narrative elements that define Kojima’s signature style.

00:00 - Opening Cutscene  
04:22 - Gameplay Begins  
11:52 - Sam's Shelter Cutscene  
22:37 - Delivery Preparations  
28:13 - First Delivery Begins  
35:37 - Wind Storm  
39:29 - Delivery Terminal

#DeathStranding2  #IGN  #Gaming
title: Death Stranding 2: First 43 Minutes of Gameplay | 4K PS5 Pro

author: IGN
description:
Death Stranding 2: On the Beach reviewed by Simon Cardy on PlayStation 5 Pro.

The original Death Stranding held promise: A complex, often confusing, but never contrived first draft. A reflective journey across a lost America, it established a world and its rules with a flourish, even if I found it stumbled along the path. But in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, Australia plays host to an expanded vision and is a more accomplished achievement in nearly every facet. It removes almost all of the friction that weighed down its rookie effort, delighting with a truly unpredictable story full of intrigue and malleable stealth-action playgrounds hidden in its vast, hauntingly beautiful version of Australia. Yes, at times, it is unapologetically weird – but that isn't what defines it. It's an inventive journey packed full of both shock and awe, the sort of bold work that deserves to be encouraged. No, it isn't perfect, but it's incredibly exciting and original, never once straying from the pa
title: Death Stranding 2: On the Beach Review
